intro: Celtis goudotii, commonly known as the African hackberry, is a small to medium-sized deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cannabaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by spherical, fuzzy fruits that are edible for some animals. Celtis goudotii is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both dry and moist environments. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
